text: June Rosalind Spencer, (14 June 1919 â€“ 8 November 2024) was an English actress. She was best known as the voice of Peggy Woolley in the BBC Radio 4 soap opera The Archers. Spencer attended Mountford House preparatory school and Nottingham Girls' High School, which she left at the age of 15 to look after her mother. After joining an amateur dramatic society, she earned a London Guildhall School of Music and Drama certificate. She also studied at Stockwin Music College from the age of 12. Spencer turned 100 in June 2019. She died on 8 November 2024 in Leatherhead, Surrey at the age of 105. == References == Category:1919 births Category:2024 deaths Category:People from Nottingham Category:English radio actors Category:English stage actors Category:English television actors Category:English centenarians
title: June Spencer
